content_1: Russia. Â A fifth case of bird flu has been confirmed at a small farm in the Rostov Region, south Russia, close to the site of previous outbreaks (see below). According to RIA Novosti, a Russian news site, the Rostov Region is particularly vulnerable to bird flu as part of the Krasnodar Territory, which is on a route taken by migrating birds in winter. Vietnam. A four-year-old boy from Son La province that died from H5N1 on December 16 (see below for details) may have been infected from wild birds. All poultry around the boy's home have tested negative. But according to Van Dang Ky, an official with the Department of Animal Health, the boy might have been exposed to the virus from wild birds that family members brought home after hunting.
